SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
NONPROFIT CLOUD
Gift Transactions

Use gift transactions to track donations that you receive as one-time gifts or as an installment to fulfill a commitment.

With Fundraising, you can efficiently attribute gift transactions to a commitment, campaign, and donor. You can easily allocate the transaction amounts to designations in percentages that the donor specifies. Easily manage refunds and soft credits for a gift transaction.

A donor can pay a transaction through multiple means, including cash, stocks, or assets. When you process gift entries, Fundraising automatically creates or updates the associated gift transactions. Also, when you schedule and process a gift commitment, Fundraising automatically creates the associated gift transactions. For example, when you set up a $200 monthly gift commitment due on the 15th starting January 2023, a gift transaction is created for the first installment with the transaction due date of January 15, 2023.

You can manually create a gift transaction for a commitment, if necessary. Use the gift commitment record’s details page to review the upcoming, missed, or failed, and recently paid or refunded transactions.

Update the status of a gift transaction to indicate its current state. Only these status updates are allowed.

ORIGINAL STATUS	UPDATED STATUS

Paid
Failed

Canceled

IMPORTANT In a multicurrency org, changing the currency ISO code of a gift transaction doesn't change the currency ISO codes of the associated records. As a result, changing the currency ISO code of a gift transaction can cause discrepancies between the amount values for the transaction and for the associated records.

SEE ALSO

Gift Entry and Processing
Gift Designation Hierarchy
Gift Commitments
Add a Designation to a Gift Transaction
Allocate or reallocate gift amounts associated with a gift transaction to gift designations of the donor's choice.
Add a Gift Soft Credit to a Gift Transaction
Create a soft credit to recognize someone other than the donor for their help in bringing in the donor's gift. For example, track an influencer of the donation by adding this soft credit to the donor's gift transaction. You can also recognized tribute honorees as soft credit recipients.
Provide a Full or Partial Refund
Create a refund to ensure that the associated gift transaction contains the complete transaction history. Return the full or a partial gift amount to the donor. Use refunds to resolve gift entry mistakes or to honor a donor's request to reverse their gift.
Create a Gift Transaction
Create a gift transaction for a one-time gift payment or for an installment of a gift commitment, if one doesn’t exist. Fundraising automatically creates a gift transaction when you create a gift entry or schedule a gift commitment.

title: Managing Gift Transactions in Nonprofit Cloud
